info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 24 at 11:24AM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Iowa...
Cedar River at Vinton affecting Benton County.
Cedar River at Cedar Rapids affecting Linn County.
Cedar River AT Palo Blairs Ferry Rd affecting Linn County.
Cedar River at Cedar Bluff affecting Cedar, Muscatine and Johnson Counties.
...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Iowa...
Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties.
...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River at Marengo affecting Benton and Iowa Counties.
.Heavy rainfall of 1 to 3 inches fell across portions of central and eastern Iowa Monday evening, June 21. The combination of heavy rain this past week, and potentially heavy rains across Iowa and southern Minnesota in the next 3 days has brought the potential for significant river flooding on the Cedar River and Iowa River. As this rainfall materializes the next few days, forecasts for rivers will become more confident, and flood warnings may be required.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...Cedar River at Palo Blairs Ferry Rd.
* WHEN...From Sunday evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 14.3 feet, The boat ramp just west of the Blairs Ferry Road bridge is closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet.
info.instruction:
If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding.
The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 1130 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
